Since the series converges absolutely, we can switch the order of summation:
  S = Σⱼ₌₂^2008 Σₖ₌₂^∞ 1/j^k.

text:
Evaluate the inner sum for a fixed j:
  For any fixed j (with j ≥ 2), consider
    A = Σₖ₌₂^∞ 1/j^k.

  S = Σⱼ₌₂^2008 1/(j(j - 1)).

text:
Recognize the telescoping form:
  Notice that
    1/(j(j - 1)) = 1/(j - 1) - 1/j.
class-1-reason: Recognizing and verifying the telescoping form of the expression.
class-2-reason: Recognizing and stating the telescoping form of the expression.

text:
This can be verified by writing:
  1/(j - 1) - 1/j = (j - (j - 1))/(j(j - 1)) = 1/(j(j - 1)).
class-1-reason: Recognizing and verifying the telescoping form of the expression.
class-2-reason: Verifying the telescoping form by showing the equivalence through algebraic manipulation.
